001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003import java.util.Optional;
004
005import org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair;
006import org.apache.commons.math3.random.MersenneTwister;
007import org.apache.commons.rng.UniformRandomProvider;
008import org.apache.commons.statistics.distribution.BetaDistribution;
009import org.apache.commons.statistics.distribution.BinomialDistribution;
010import org.apache.commons.statistics.distribution.GammaDistribution;
011import org.apache.commons.statistics.distribution.LogNormalDistribution;
012import org.apache.commons.statistics.distribution.PascalDistribution;
013import org.apache.commons.statistics.distribution.PoissonDistribution;
014
015import io.github.ai4ci.functions.SimpleDistribution;
016
017/**
018 * A thread local random number generator provider with convenience sampling
019 * methods.
020 *
021 * <p>
022 * This class offers a thread local instance of a Mersenne Twister generator and
023 * convenience methods to sample common distributions. Methods are synchronised
024 * where the underlying generator is used to ensure thread safety when an
025 * instance is shared across code that does not manage concurrency externally.
026 * </p>
027 *
028 * <p>
029 * Downstream uses: this class is used across the project wherever one-shot
030 * samples or small stochastic simulations are required.
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * @author Rob Challen
034 */
035public class Sampler implements UniformRandomProvider {
036
037        /**
038         * Exception thrown when a distribution parameter is out of range.
039         */
040        public static class OutOfRangeException extends RuntimeException {
041                OutOfRangeException(String s) {
042                        super(s);
043                }
044        }
045
046        private static ThreadLocal<Sampler> INSTANCE = ThreadLocal
047                        .withInitial(() -> new Sampler());
048
049        /**
050         * Obtain the thread local sampler instance.
051         *
052         * @return the thread local sampler
053         */
054        public static Sampler getSampler() { return INSTANCE.get(); }
055
056        /**
057         * This provides access to a thread local RNG with a given seed. It sets that
058         * seed for the thread which will affect future users of the sampler.
059         *
060         * @param urn an identifier string used to set the seed
061         *
062         * @return the thread local sampler with the seed set for this thread
063         */
064        public static Sampler getSampler(String urn) {
065                return INSTANCE.get().withSeed(urn);
066        }
067
068        private static double invLogit(double x) {
069                return 1 / (1 + Math.exp(-x));
070        }
071
072        private static double logit(double p) {
073                return Math.log(p / (1 - p));
074        }
075
076        private static LogNormalDistribution logNormalfromMeanAndSd(
077                        double mean, double sd
078        ) {
079                if (mean <= 0) {
080                        throw new OutOfRangeException("Log normal mean is <= 0");
081                }
082                if (sd <= 0) { throw new OutOfRangeException("Log normal sd is < 0"); }
083                var mu = Math.log(mean / (Math.sqrt(Math.pow(sd / mean, 2) + 1)));
084                var sigma = Math.sqrt(Math.log(Math.pow(sd / mean, 2) + 1));
085                return LogNormalDistribution.of(mu, sigma);
086        }
087
088        MersenneTwister random;
089
090        long seed;
091
092        private Sampler() {
093                this.seed = System.currentTimeMillis();
094                this.random = new MersenneTwister(this.seed);
095        }
096
097        private Sampler(String urn) {
098                this();
099                this.withSeed(urn);
100        }
101
102        /**
103         * Bernoulli trial returning true with probability jointDetect.
104         *
105         * @param jointDetect probability of success
106         * @return true if event occurs
107         */
108        public boolean bern(double jointDetect) {
109                return this.random.nextDouble() < jointDetect;
110        }
111
112        /**
113         * Bernoulli trial returning value with probability p, otherwise empty.
114         *
115         * @param <X>   the type of the value to return on success
116         * @param p     probability of success
117         * @param value the value to return if success
118         * @return Optional containing value if event occurs, otherwise empty
119         */
120        public <X> Optional<X> bern(Double p, X value) {
121                if (this.bern(p)) { return Optional.of(value); }
122                return Optional.empty();
123        }
124
125        /**
126         * Draw a Beta sample parameterised by mean and sd. If convex is true the sd
127         * is scaled to ensure a unimodal beta distribution.
128         *
129         * @param mean   the mean in (0,1)
130         * @param sd     the standard deviation or a fraction when convex is true
131         * @param convex whether to constrain sd for unimodality
132         * @return a Beta sample in (0,1)
133         */
134        public synchronized double beta(double mean, double sd, boolean convex) {
135                if (convex) {
136                        // This constraint makes beta distribution convex and therefore
137                        // unimodal
138                        var sigma = Math.sqrt(
139                                        Math.min(
140                                                        mean * mean * (1 - mean) / (1 + mean),
141                                                        (1 - mean) * (1 - mean) * (mean) / (2 - mean)
142                                        )
143                        );
144                        sd = sd * sigma;
145                }
146                var tmp = mean * (1 - mean) / (sd * sd) - 1;
147                if (tmp <= 0) { tmp = Double.MIN_NORMAL; }
148                var alpha = tmp * mean;
149                var beta = tmp * (1 - mean);
150                return BetaDistribution.of(alpha, beta).createSampler(this).sample();
151        }
152
153        /**
154         * Draw a Binomial sample parameterised by mean and sd. The implied count is
155         * derived from the supplied mean and sd.
156         *
157         * @param mean the mean
158         * @param sd   the standard deviation
159         * @return a Binomial sample
160         */
161        public synchronized int binom(double mean, double sd) {
162                var n = (int) Math.round(mean / (1 - (sd * sd) / mean));
163                if (n < 0) {
164                        throw new OutOfRangeException(
165                                        "SD is too big and implied binomial count is <= 0"
166                        );
167                }
168                var p = mean / n;
169                return BinomialDistribution.of(n, p).createSampler(this).sample();
170        }
171
172        /**
173         * Draw a Binomial sample with fixed count and probability.
174         *
175         * @param count       number of trials (non-negative)
176         * @param probability success probability
177         * @return Binomial sample
178         */
179        public synchronized int binom(int count, double probability) {
180                if (count < 0) {
181                        throw new OutOfRangeException("Binomial count is <= 0");
182                }
183                return BinomialDistribution.of(count, probability).createSampler(this)
184                                .sample();
185        }
186
187        /**
188         * Draw a Gamma( mean, 1 ) sample.
189         *
190         * @param mean the mean
191         * @return a Gamma sample
192         */
193        public synchronized double gamma(double mean) {
194                return GammaDistribution.of(mean, 1).createSampler(this).sample();
195        }
196
197        /**
198         * Draw a Gamma sample parameterised by mean and sd.
199         *
200         * @param mean the mean
201         * @param sd   the standard deviation
202         * @return a Gamma sample
203         */
204        public synchronized double gamma(double mean, double sd) {
205                var shape = (mean * mean) / (sd * sd);
206                var scale = (sd * sd) / mean;
207                return GammaDistribution.of(shape, scale).createSampler(this).sample();
208        }
209
210        /**
211         * Draw a logit-normal sample using median and scale.
212         *
213         * @param median the median probability
214         * @param scale  a scale parameter controlling dispersion
215         * @return a sample in (0,1)
216         */
217        public synchronized double logitNormal(double median, double scale) {
218                var mu = logit(median);
219                // double sigma = scale*(1+Math.abs(mu));
220                var sigma = scale * (2 + Math.pow(Math.abs(mu), (7.0 / 4.0)));
221                return invLogit(this.random.nextGaussian() * sigma + mu);
222        }
223
224        /**
225         * Draw a log-normal sample parameterised by mean and sd.
226         *
227         * @param mean the mean (>0)
228         * @param sd   the standard deviation (>0)
229         * @return a log-normal sample
230         */
231        public synchronized double logNormal(double mean, double sd) {
232                if (sd == 0) { return mean; }
233                return logNormalfromMeanAndSd(mean, sd).createSampler(this).sample();
234
235        }
236
237        /**
238         * Draw a sample from a multinomial distribution defined by the provided
239         * probabilities and associated values. The probabilities should sum to 1 or
240         * less, with any shortfall representing the probability of an empty outcome.
241         *
242         * @param <X>           the type of the values to return on success
243         * @param probabilities array of pairs of (probability, value)
244         * @return Optional containing the sampled value if an outcome occurs,
245         *         otherwise empty
246         */
247        @SafeVarargs
248        public final <X> Optional<X> multinom(Pair<Double, X>... probabilities) {
249                var tmp = this.uniform();
250                for (Pair<Double, X> element : probabilities) {
251                        if (tmp < element.getKey()) { return Optional.of(element.getValue()); }
252                        tmp = tmp - element.getKey();
253                }
254                return Optional.empty();
255        }
256
257        /**
258         * Draw a negative binomial sample parameterised by mean and sd.
259         *
260         * @param mean the mean
261         * @param sd   the standard deviation
262         * @return a Pascal (negative binomial) sample
263         */
264        public synchronized int negBinom(double mean, double sd) {
265                var r = (int) Math.round((mean * mean) / (sd * sd - mean));
266                var p = mean / (sd * sd);
267                return PascalDistribution.of(r, p).createSampler(this).sample();
268        }
269
270        @Override
271        public synchronized long nextLong() {
272                return this.random.nextLong();
273        }
274
275        /**
276         * Draw a normal sample with specified mean and standard deviation.
277         *
278         * @param mean the mean
279         * @param sd   the standard deviation
280         * @return a normal sample
281         */
282        public synchronized double normal(double mean, double sd) {
283                if (sd == 0) { return mean; }
284                return this.random.nextGaussian() * sd + mean;
285        }
286
287        /**
288         * Random exponential model trigger with average period.
289         *
290         * @param period average period
291         * @return true if event occurs
292         */
293        public boolean periodTrigger(double period) {
294                return this.bern(Conversions.probabilityFromPeriod(period));
295        }
296
297        /**
298         * Random exponential model trigger using a specified quantile.
299         *
300         * @param period   average period
301         * @param quantile quantile used to derive probability
302         * @return true if event occurs
303         */
304        public boolean periodTrigger(double period, double quantile) {
305                return this.bern(Conversions.probabilityFromQuantile(period, quantile));
306        }
307
308        /**
309         * Draw a Poisson sample with given mean.
310         *
311         * @param mean the mean (>=0)
312         * @return a Poisson sample
313         */
314        public synchronized int poisson(double mean) {
315                if (mean == 0) { return 0; }
316                return PoissonDistribution.of(mean).createSampler(this).sample();
317        }
318
319        /**
320         * Convert a per-unit rate to a Bernoulli outcome using
321         * Conversions.probabilityFromRate(rate).
322         *
323         * @param rate the rate per unit time
324         * @return true if event occurs
325         */
326        public boolean rateTrigger(double rate) {
327                return this.bern(Conversions.probabilityFromRate(rate));
328        }
329
330        /**
331         * Sample from a provided SimpleDistribution using this sampler.
332         *
333         * @param dist the distribution to sample from
334         * @return a sample
335         */
336        public double sample(SimpleDistribution dist) {
337                return dist.sample(this);
338        }
339
340        /**
341         * Sample an integer by flooring the continuous sample from the given
342         * distribution.
343         *
344         * @param dist the distribution to sample from
345         * @return an integer sample
346         */
347        public int sampleInt(SimpleDistribution dist) {
348                return (int) Math.floor(dist.sample(this));
349        }
350
351        /**
352         * Draw a uniform sample on [0,1).
353         *
354         * @return a uniform double in [0,1)
355         */
356        public synchronized double uniform() {
357                return this.random.nextDouble();
358        }
359
360        /**
361         * Draw a uniform sample on [min, max).
362         *
363         * @param min the minimum value (inclusive)
364         * @param max the maximum value (exclusive)
365         * @return a uniform double in [min, max)
366         */
367        public double uniform(double min, double max) {
368                return this.uniform() * (max - min) + min;
369        }
370
371        /**
372         * Set the sampler seed derived from the provided string and return this
373         * instance for fluent use.
374         *
375         * @param urn an identifier string used to set the seed
376         * @return this sampler instance
377         */
378        public Sampler withSeed(String urn) {
379                long tmp = (urn + ":thread:" + Thread.currentThread().getId()).hashCode();
380                if (this.seed != tmp) {
381                        this.seed = tmp;
382                        this.random.setSeed(tmp);
383                }
384                return this;
385        }
386
387        /**
388         * Draw from a zero-inflated Poisson distribution.
389         *
390         * @param probabilityZero the mass at zero
391         * @param poissonMean     the Poisson mean
392         * @return the sample
393         */
394        public synchronized int zeroInflatedPoisson(
395                        double probabilityZero, double poissonMean
396        ) {
397                if (this.uniform() < probabilityZero) { return 0; }
398                return this.poisson(poissonMean);
399        }
400
401}
